name: Factorial Sums
description:
Suppose we have a function f such that f(x) is equal to the sum of the digits in x!. for each input Z, find the smallest number Y such that f(Y) = Z. For example, for a Z such as 9, we would list factorials:
f(1) = 1
f(2) = 2
f(3) = 6
f(4) = 2+4 = 6
f(5) = 1+2+0 =
f(6) = 7+2+0 = 9

The smallest number whos factorial digits sum to 9 is therefore 6. For this problem, you may assume that all given Y are less than 1,000,000

test_cases: It can get pretty crazy in here!
solutions: It can get pretty crazy in here!
